update.description:
We (Open Robotics), have received a request to use a `metadata.pbtxt` file as an alternative to `model.config` for Fuel resources.

The benefit are:

1. A well-defined format, as opposed to a loosely defined XML format.
2. Ability to serialize and transmit meta data over the wire.
3. Easily convert this data to JSON for use with other REST APIs and services like ElasticSearch. 

The near-term consumer of these messages is only the `ign-fuel-tools` library. The CLI offered by ign-fuel-tools will be extended to upload models. During upload, the `ign-fuel-tools` library will read either a `metadata.txt` file, using the format defined here, or the `model.config` file.

See #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/pull-requests/108, which uses the messages in this PR.
update.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw:
Do we expect any other libraries to use this function besides `ign-fuel_tools`? If not, I'd suggest we move these conversion functions there, for 2 reasons:

* avoid adding the TinyXML dependency to `ign-msgs`
* The less places we have handling  `model.config`, the easier it should be to eventually deprecate its use
content.html:
Do we expect any other libraries to use this function besides ign-fuel_tools? If not, I'd suggest we move these conversion functions there, for 2 reasons:

  • avoid adding the TinyXML dependency to ign-msgs
  • The less places we have handling model.config, the easier it should be to eventually deprecate its use

pullrequest.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

content.raw:
there are Ubuntu compiler warnings because `major()` and `minor()` are macros in the GNU C library

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=241)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/241/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/241/warningsResult/
* https://stackoverflow.com/a/22253389/7179595

options:

* `major_number`, `major_component` (not ideal)
* if we want to use `major` and `minor`, perhaps we should `#undef` them in the generated header file?
content.html:
there are Ubuntu compiler warnings because major() and minor() are macros in the GNU C library

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_msgs-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/241/warningsResult/
  • https://stackoverflow.com/a/22253389/7179595

options:

  • major_number, major_component (not ideal)
  • if we want to use major and minor, perhaps we should #undef them in the generated header file?

2. Ability to serialize and transmit meta data over the wire.
3. Easily convert this data to JSON for use with other REST APIs and services like ElasticSearch. 

The near-term consumer of these messages is only the `ign-fuel-tools` library. The CLI offered by ign-fuel-tools will be extended to upload models. During upload, the `ign-fuel-tools` library will read either a `metadata.txt` file, using the format defined here, or the `model.config` file.
update.title: Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

pull_request.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

update.description:
We (Open Robotics), have received a request to use a `metadata.pbtxt` file as an alternative to `model.config` for Fuel resources.

The benefit are:

1. A well-defined format, as opposed to a loosely defined XML format.
2. Ability to serialize and transmit meta data over the wire.
3. Easily convert this data to JSON for use with other REST APIs and services like ElasticSearch. 

The near-term consumer of these messages is only the `ign-fuel-tools` library. The CLI offered by ign-fuel-tools will be extended to upload models. During upload, the `ign-fuel-tools` library will read either a `metadata.txt` file, using the format defined here, or the `model.config` file.
update.title: Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'

pull_request.title: [Citadel] Fuel resource metadata, which can be used instead of 'model.config'
